content: uss enterprise amigurumi pattern figure 1 complete uss enterprise notes  this pattern was made by andrea bruce january 2014 for a friend  this pattern is free but please give credit to the author if you finish the design i also requests that the final product not be sold as this was intended to build the crocheting community  this is the author s first amigurimi pattern i have only been crocheting for 3 months my apologies for any beginner mistakes my apologies for the poor photography  if i were to redo this pattern over again i would reinforce the sauce section with a lasso shaped 12 gauge wire having the handle sticking out the back of the saucer section to help reinforce the saucer section support pylon  the saucer section pattern was taken from lucy collin/lucy ravenscar s amigurumi totoro tummy http //www ravelry com/patterns/library/grey-totoro-amigurumi materials 8 of 12 gauge aluminum wire 6 of 12 gauge aluminum wire orange yarn light grey yarn white yarn dark grey yarn small length of green yarn stuffing 3 5 mm hook us e hook yarn needle abbreviations chain = chain st = stitch or stitches slip_stitch = slip_stitch single_crochet = single_crochet us double_crochet uk half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet us half treble_crochet uk double_crochet = double_crochet us treble_crochet uk decrease = together decrease = decrease by working two single_crochet together yoh = yarn over hook fo = fasten_off figure 2 warp drive nacelles core and warp nacelle support pylons warp drive nacelle make 2 using orange yarn round 1 magic_ring work 6 single_crochet into ring - 6 st round 2 2 single_crochet in next st 6 times - 12 st round 3 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet in next stitch 6 times - 18 st round 4-5 2 rounds single_crochet in each st around -18 st switch to light grey round 6 - 28 23 rounds single_crochet in each st around - 18 st stuff firmly round 29 decrease single_crochet in next st - 9 st round 30 decrease 6 times - 6 st fo warp nacelle support pylon make 2 using light grey yarn round 1 chain 4 work single_crochet in 3rd chain single_crochet in next st work 4 single_crochet in 1st chain single_crochet in next st work 3 single_crochet in 3rd chain figure 3 round 2-10 9 rounds single_crochet in each st around - 10 st fo leaving length of yarn figure 3 round 1 of support pylon use a piece of grey yarn to stitch a sealed end of a support pylon to a warp drive nacelle figure 4 figure 4 sew support pylon to drive nacelle core deflector dish to hangar deck using dark grey yarn round 1 magic_ring work 6 single_crochet into ring - 6 st round 2 2 single_crochet in next st 6 times - 12 st round 3 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet in next st 6 times - 18 st round 4 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet in next 2
